glosses: forms the comparative of the following adjective

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish دها (daha), from Old Anatolian Turkish داخی (daḫı), from Proto-Turkic *takï (“additionally, plus; again, once more”). Doublet of dahi, da, and de.
Cognate with Azerbaijani daha, Gagauz taa, Kazakh тағы (tağy), Kyrgyz дагы (dagı), Uzbek tag‘in.
